intro: Rubus yuenfengensis, commonly known as the Yuenfeng blackberry, is a species of brambles native to China. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas with moist, well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
